name: Falling
description: Creatures that fall from heights take bludgeoning damage and potentially fall prone
trigger: Falling from a height (knocked off ledge, losing grip while climbing, flying speed reduced to 0, etc.)

damage.timing: at the end of the fall

immediate: Takes 1d6 Bludgeoning damage per 10 feet fallen (maximum 20d6)
Has the Prone condition unless it avoids taking any damage from the fall

waterFalls.description: Falling into water or another liquid

savingThrow.onSuccess: Damage from fall is halved (hit surface head or feet first)

mitigation: Use climbing gear and proper technique when scaling heights
Secure yourself with rope when working at heights
Maintain your Fly Speed if airborne
Avoid becoming Incapacitated or Prone while flying
Use Feather Fall spell to slow descent
Use abilities that grant hover to stay aloft even when Incapacitated
When falling into water, use Reaction to make DC 15 STR (Athletics) or DEX (Acrobatics) check to reduce damage by half

srdReference.quote: A creature that falls takes 1d6 Bludgeoning damage at the end of the fall for every 10 feet it fell, to a maximum of 20d6. When the creature lands, it has the Prone condition unless it avoids taking any damage from the fall. A creature that falls into water or another liquid can use its Reaction to make a DC 15 Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check to hit the surface head or feet first. On a successful check, any damage resulting from the fall is halved.

examples: Pushed off a cliff - 100 feet (10d6 damage)
Knocked off castle wall - 40 feet (4d6 damage)
Falling from flying mount - 200 feet (20d6 damage, maximum)
Diving into deep water - 60 feet (potentially 3d6 with successful check)
